docs.title: Vindicta Oracle Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the Vindicta Oracle documentation — meta analysis, predictions, and the AI debate council for the Vindicta Platform.

docs.title: Modules
docs.text:
• Meta-Seer: Faction meta analysis and heuristic evaluation.
  • Arbiter Council: Multi-model AI debate and consensus engine.

docs.title: Links
docs.text:
• GitHub Repository
  • Foundation & Standards

docs.title: Setup Guide
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/vindicta-platform/Meta-Oracle.git
cd Meta-Oracle
uv venv && uv pip install -e ".[dev]"

docs.title: Agent Roles
docs.text: Agent Role Home Argues for your list's strengths Adversary Argues for opponent's advantages Arbiter Provides statistical context Rule-Sage Validates mechanical claims Council Synthesizes final prediction

docs.title: Debate Protocol
docs.text:
1. Home makes opening argument
  2. Adversary counters
  3. Arbiter adds data
  4. Rule-Sage validates claims
  5. Council renders verdict

docs.title: Rule-Sage Auditing
docs.text: All mechanical claims must: - Cite valid rule IDs - Reference existing units only - Use correct move notation

docs.title: Oracle
docs.text:
from meta_oracle import Oracle

oracle = Oracle()
result = oracle.predict(my_list, opponent_list, mission="Purge the Enemy")

docs.title: PredictionResult
docs.text:
class PredictionResult:
    probability: float  # 0.0 to 1.0
    confidence: float   # margin of error
    factors: list[str]  # key factors

docs.title: Sleeper Detection
docs.text: sleepers = oracle.find_sleepers(faction="Tyranids")

docs.title: Pre-Commit Hooks (Required)
docs.text:
All contributors must install and run pre-commit hooks before committing. 

uv pip install pre-commit
pre-commit install

docs.title: Setup
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/vindicta-platform/Meta-Oracle.git
cd Meta-Oracle
uv venv && uv pip install -e ".[dev]"
pytest tests/ -v

MIT License

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: uv pip install git+https://github.com/vindicta-platform/Meta-Oracle.git

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Python 3.10+
  • Gemini API key (for AI inference)

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: export GOOGLE_API_KEY=your-api-key

docs.title: First Prediction
docs.text:
from meta_oracle import Oracle

oracle = Oracle()
result = oracle.predict(my_list, opponent_list)

docs.title: ADR-XXX: [Title]
docs.text: Status: Proposed | Accepted Date: YYYY-MM-DD

docs.title: ADR-001: Python as Primary Language
docs.text: Status: Accepted | Date: 2026-02-01

docs.title: Decision
docs.text: Python 3.10+ with Gemini API integration.

docs.title: Rationale
docs.text:
• Vindicta Platform is Python-first
  • Google AI Python SDK

docs.title: Alternatives Considered
docs.text: TypeScript, Rust — Rejected for ecosystem consistency.

docs.title: ADR-002: Pre-commit Hooks Required
docs.text: Status: Accepted | Date: 2026-02-01

docs.title: Decision
docs.text: Pre-commit with ruff required.

docs.title: Feature Proposal: Meta-Oracle Match Prediction API
docs.text: Proposal ID: FEAT-011 Author: Unified Product Architect (Autonomous) Created: 2026-02-01 Status: Draft Priority: High Target Repository: Meta-Oracle

docs.title: 1. Executive Summary
docs.text: Expose a public API for match predictions, allowing players to query expected win probabilities, optimal secondaries, and key matchup insights based on faction/subfaction combinations.

docs.title: 2.1 Current State
docs.text:
• Internal analytics engine
  • No public API
  • Batch-processed statistics

docs.title: 2.3 File Changes
docs.text:
Meta-Oracle/
├── src/
│   └── meta_oracle/
│       ├── api/
│       │   ├── __init__.py      [NEW]
│       │   ├── routes.py        [NEW] FastAPI routes
│       │   └── schemas.py       [NEW] Request/response models
│       ├── prediction/
│       │   ├── match.py         [NEW] Match outcome predictor
│       │   ├── secondaries.py   [NEW] Secondary optimizer
│       │   └── matchups.py      [NEW] Matchup analysis
│       └── data/
│           └── aggregator.py    [MODIFY] API-friendly queries
├── tests/
│   └── test_prediction_api.py   [NEW]
└── docs/
    └── api.md                   [NEW] API documentation

docs.title: 3. API Endpoints
docs.text: Method Endpoint Description POST /api/v1/predict/match Predict match outcome GET /api/v1/stats/faction/{id} Faction win rates GET /api/v1/stats/matchup Head-to-head stats POST /api/v1/recommend/secondaries Optimal secondary objectives GET /api/v1/meta/trends Current meta trends

docs.title: 4. Prediction Request/Response
docs.text:
class MatchPredictionRequest(BaseModel):
    player1_faction: str
    player1_subfaction: Optional[str]
    player2_faction: str
    player2_subfaction: Optional[str]
    mission: Optional[str]
    points_limit: int = 2000

class MatchPredictionResponse(BaseModel):
    player1_win_probability: float  # 0.0 - 1.0
    player2_win_probability: float
    confidence: float               # Algorithm confidence
    key_factors: list[str]          # "Player 1 has strong anti-vehicle"
    recommended_secondaries: dict[str, list[str]]
    sample_size: int                # Games analyzed

docs.title: 5. Rate Limiting
docs.text: Tier Requests/Hour Cache TTL Anonymous 10 1 hour Free Member 50 30 min Supporter 200 15 min Champion 1000 5 min

docs.title: 6. Data Sources
docs.text:
• Historical battle logs from Vindicta platform
  • Tournament results (40kstats integration potential)
  • ELO-weighted outcomes
  • Regularly updated meta snapshots

docs.title: US-001: Pre-Game Analysis
docs.text: As a tournament player I want to check my matchup before a game So that I can prepare an optimal strategy

docs.title: US-002: Secondary Selection
docs.text: As a competitive player I want AI-recommended secondaries So that I maximize my scoring potential

docs.title: US-003: Meta Insights
docs.text: As a list builder I want to see current faction win rates So that I can build competitive lists

docs.title: Acceptance Criteria
docs.text:
Feature: Match Prediction API

  Scenario: Predict match outcome
    Given I submit a prediction request
      | player1_faction | Necrons       |
      | player2_faction | Space Marines |
    When the API processes the request
    Then I should receive win probabilities for each player
    And the confidence score based on sample size
    And key matchup insights

  Scenario: Get secondary recommendations
    Given my faction is "Aeldari"
    And opponent faction is "Death Guard"
    And mission is "Take and Hold"
    When I request secondary recommendations
    Then I should receive ranked secondary objectives
    And expected success rates for each

  Scenario: Rate limit enforcement
    Given I am an anonymous user
    When I exceed 10 requests in an hour
    Then I should receive a 429 Too Many Requests
    And a message indicating upgrade options

docs.title: Implementation Estimate
docs.text: Phase Effort Dependencies API Routes 4 hours FastAPI Prediction Engine 12 hours Historical data Secondary Recommender 8 hours Mission data Rate Limiting 3 hours Redis Documentation 3 hours OpenAPI Testing 4 hours None Total 34 hours
